name: Organizational Claim Investigation
description: Investigates claims made by organizations (companies, NGOs, institutions) by tracing to verifiable evidence. Based on ICIJ shell-company tracing methodology and Bellingcat multi-source corroboration.

levels.name: Identify the Claim and the Organization

task.purpose: Extract and contextualize the specific claim from "{evidence.description}". Every organizational claim must be understood in the context of the organization's interests — entities rarely publicize information that damages their interests.
keyTasks: Extract the specific claim being made.
Research the organization: type (for-profit, nonprofit, government, industry group, advocacy), founding date, leadership, stated mission.
Identify the organization's commercial or ideological interest in the claim being true.
Determine the organization's revenue source and how it relates to the claim.
task.endState: Claim extracted, organization profiled (type, leadership, mission, revenue), and interest in claim documented.

requiredOutputs.description: Organization type: for-profit, nonprofit, government, industry-group, advocacy
How the organization benefits from the claim being true

task.purpose: Find and evaluate the evidence behind "{parent.claim}" made by the organization. Claims without verifiable evidence are unsubstantiated. Claims that exaggerate their evidence are misleading.
keyTasks: Find the evidence the organization cites to support the claim.
If they cite a study, locate the actual study (not just the press release).
If they cite data, find the original dataset.
Check if the evidence actually supports the claim as stated, or if the claim exaggerates or misrepresents the evidence.
task.endState: Supporting evidence located (or confirmed absent), and accuracy of the organization's representation assessed.

requiredOutputs.description: Whether the cited evidence was found
Whether evidence supports the claim as stated
Whether the claim exaggerates the evidence
Whether the claim misrepresents the evidence
Whether favorable evidence was selectively chosen

task.purpose: Investigate whether the organization behind "{parent.claim}" has a history of regulatory actions or legal challenges. Past enforcement actions are strong signals about organizational credibility.
keyTasks: Search for FDA warning letters, FTC enforcement actions, or equivalent regulatory actions against this organization.
Search for lawsuits related to the claim — class actions, false advertising suits.
Check BBB complaints, consumer protection actions.
Search for recalls or corrections issued by or about the organization.
task.endState: Regulatory and legal history documented: enforcement actions, lawsuits, complaints, recalls cataloged or confirmed absent.

task.purpose: Seek independent corroboration or contradiction of "{parent.claim}". Organizational claims — even well-evidenced ones — require external validation from unaffiliated parties.
keyTasks: Search for independent parties (unaffiliated researchers, competing organizations, consumer watchdogs) who have evaluated the same claim.
Search for investigative journalism about this organization.
Check Glassdoor, whistleblower reports, or internal leaks relevant to the claim.
Synthesize all findings into an overall corroboration assessment.
task.endState: Independent corroboration landscape mapped: evaluations, investigations, and insider accounts cataloged with overall assessment.

requiredOutputs.description: Overall corroboration assessment: confirmed, partially-confirmed, unconfirmed, contradicted
